Speaker: first draft
Dialogue: September 18, 1995

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: The head is born!  One arm... the other arm... it is a boy!

Speaker: advisor 1
Dialogue: I shall tell the king!

Speaker: advisor 2
Dialogue: I shall tell him!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: M'lady...?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Another...?  It is another!

Speaker: musketeer
Dialogue: Away.

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: You dead yet?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Ah ha!  Here we are!  Aramis! Porthos is here!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Aaaaaaaramis!!  Porthos is --

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Sorry, my dears.  You would have enjoyed it too.  He's hung like a donkey.

Speaker: wench 1
Dialogue: So are you.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Really?  I haven't been able to see it for fifteen years.  Go on now, leave His Holiness alone.  I'll bring you back tomorrow when he's in a better mood.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Please revel with me, Aramis, I need my spirits lifted.  I'm old, I'm weak, my strength is gone --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Be quiet, you fat fool.  Can't you see I'm praying?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I just said you're praying!  Are you deaf too?  I know you're blind, because if you had seen the tits that just walked out of here, you'd have tears in your eyes.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: There are more important things than tits.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Really?  If you can name me one thing, one single thing, that is more sublime than the feel of a plump pink nipple between my lips, I will buy you a new cathedral.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Forgiveness.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Forgiveness?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Forgive me.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Am I forgiven?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I observe your forgiveness isn't sweeter than a plump nipple.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Can't you see I'm praying, goddammit?!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: How are you, you skinny little pup!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: A simple theological discussion.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Still you serve him loyally -- though people hurl rotten eggs at his royal emblem.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Deep and hard, D'Artagnan.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: We were all Musketeers once, eh?  Oh, I forgot.  For the poor, the ones you were praying for.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I wonder how Athos is doing.

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Do I look all right?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: None of the ladies will be able to take their eyes off you.

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: I care only about Michelle.  Should I ask her when we first arrive? Or... or when we're leaving?  I could ask her in the carriage -- but it is more romantic at the palace. I get so confused...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Perhaps this will help.

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Mother's ring.  I can't take this.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: She died giving you to me.  And I want to die knowing it is one the finger of the women my son loves.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Now go, and bring back your fiance.

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: Your Majesty, I know it is a... a festive time, but before --

Speaker: king louis
Dialogue: The blue sash.  No, the burgundy!

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: ... before the party begins --

Speaker: king louis
Dialogue: The party has already begun -- so why are you delaying me?

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: We do not wish to delay you, Majesty, but... as your advisors, we feel it is our -- our --

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: ... our duty.

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: Yes!  It is our duty to let you know... there are riots in Paris.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Riots?  My people live in the world's most beautiful city, their king has the grandest palaces on earth.  Why should they feel anything but pride and contentment?

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: Well yes, of course, Majesty, and I'm sure they are content... except that... well, they are starving.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Sometimes the poor do grow hungry. But why would they riot about it?

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: Majesty... We have more than enough food set aside for your birthday celebration next week.  If we distributed some of that, we would have time to gather more before --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Aramis!  I have been expecting you!  We are satisfied, that will do.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Your birthday celebration, your Majesty?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Next week.  This is a mere garden party -- and I wish to join it, so I will be brief.  I am experiencing resistance from the Jesuits.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Well... perhaps you should speak with them, your Majesty.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I have demanded it -- and common priests present themselves!  Can you imagine the arrogance?  Common Jesuit priests try to act as my equals, and they refuse to reveal the names of anyone else in their order!  No one can keep secrets like the Jesuits can, and the identity of their leader is the darkest secret they hold.  Even the Pope himself does not know who leads the Jesuit Order in France!  He suspects the Governor General of Jesuits, whoever he is, is angling to become Pope himself.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: How can I serve you in this?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Perhaps you can find out who this secret leader of the Jesuits is. You are now a priest, but you were once a Musketeer, serving the throne of France, a throne ordained of God. Can you accept this mission, and keep it private?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: If I find out the identity of this Jesuit rebel.  I will kill both him and the man who told me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Once a Musketeer, always a Musketeer, eh?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Ah yes, the riots.  We have food stocks on the wharves right now, no?

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: That food has spoiled.  That is why it was not shipped to the army.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Exactly why it should be given away.

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: What... an excellent idea, your Majesty!

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Isn't it glorious!

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Michelle...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Who is that?

Speaker: friend 1
Dialogue: Raoul, son of Athos.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Not the soldier, you idiot!

Speaker: friend 2
Dialogue: Her name is Michelle.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What is it, d'Artagnan?  Assassins falling from the sky now?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I decided it this morning.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I am King, d'Artagnan.  I will change my mind as I wish, and I will enjoy my banquet as I wish!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Let us play a game, d'Artagnan, let us pretend I am King and you are Captain of my Musketeers.  Let us behave as if my wish is law.  And my wish is to enjoy this party!

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Michelle, I... Ever since I returned I've been wanting to speak with you about... about --

Speaker: servant
Dialogue: Monsieur, Mademoiselle...?

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: No!  Thank you -- Michelle, I --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It pleases us to announce an entertainment for our guests!  A contest of agility and cunning!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Behold our unicorn!  Whichever of our guests captures the unicorn shall win its treasure!

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: I have never seen a diamond so large!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Into the maze!  All of you! Disperse, I command you!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Are you men or mice?!

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: The pendant will be yours!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Michelle, isn't it?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I would have said it was impossible, but I believe the excitement of the chase has made you even more beautiful.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Sire, I --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You blush!  You do not wish to be beautiful to your King?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Wait!  Michelle, I --

Speaker: assassin
Dialogue: Feed... your... people.

Speaker: assassin
Dialogue: Your people starve...!  Feed --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: A pitiful madman, nothing more. Come, let us continue our chase! Where is our unicorn?

Speaker: young musketeer
Dialogue: Captain!

Speaker: young musketeer
Dialogue: You are the best --

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: Food, moron.

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: Look what you've done!

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: Eh?

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: ... Two-thirty-seven.

Speaker: keeper
Dialogue: You've... memorized...?

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: She wishes a word with you.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: I understand you saved my son's life today.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: And you were not hurt?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: That is good.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Duty lists of the day, Captain!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Well, Captain...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Life is too long.  Except when we have our friends.  Look at you! You're still a boy!  Sit, sit!  I'll open a bottle of wine.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You can't drink with a friend you haven't seen in months?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Midnight!  Mon dieu!  Driving the youngsters hard, eh?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Another?  How many times have you saved his life in this year alone? Three?  Four?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I was feeling sorry for myself. Raoul is getting married, he proposed today!  I love that boy beyond all measure, I've spent everything I own to give him education and opportunity.  Now he has complete happiness, and I mope.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: That must be Raoul!  Raoul!  Look, d'Artagnan's come to visit...! What's wrong?  You look awful!

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Michelle, she -- The king has invited her to come live in the palace.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But -- are you sure?

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: We were at her door.  I was just taking the ring from my pocket, for the third time today, when a young Musketeer brought the invitation for her to become a lady-in-waiting for the Queen Mother.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Michelle cannot possibly accept!

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: She cannot possibly refuse.  Her family is poor, they have even less money than we do.  And along with the invitation, the King sent the diamond pendant, from the piglet.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Piglet -- ?  What are you -- ?

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Never mind, Papa, it doesn't matter now.  She loved me once.  I want to die remembering that.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Die?  What...?

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: I have rejoined the army, and asked to resume my commission at the head of the troops of General Fromberge.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Fromberge...?!  At the front?!  No.

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: It is already done.  I have just stopped at Mother's grave, to say goodbye, before coming to tell you.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Raoul, no... You cannot do this.  No matter how your heart is broken --

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Goodbye, father.  I am sorry.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Raoul --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: This cannot be.  Everyone knows the Queen Mother is a recluse, and the ladies-in-waiting are but mistresses for the king!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: She's a woman, d'Artagnan!  From a poor family.  You may still be young enough to believe love conquers everything, but I am old and hard and I've seen too much.  Even when kings are hunchbacks they have any woman they desire, because power seduces even more than love!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You knew this was happening.  You knew and that's why you came.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What hope is there?  A wartime commission cannot be vacated except by the king, and what chance is there of that?  Fromberge is on the battle line, and Raoul --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Raoul is everything to me.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Oh my friend.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You trust his character more than anyone else does.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Save my son, d'Artagnan.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Here is food, the gift of your loving King, on his birthday!  He gives to himself by giving to you, in that he loves you so much!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: No need to fight, there is plenty for all!

Speaker: ruffian
Dialogue: This stuff stinks.  It is rotting! The King gives us rotten food!

Speaker: panicked soldier
Dialogue: Back, toward the palace!  We cannot hold them off!  We will fire a volley into them!

Speaker: ruffian
Dialogue: Come on!  To the palace!

Speaker: mob
Dialogue: It's d'Artagnan!  Le Generale de Musketeers!

Speaker: ruffian
Dialogue: One Musketeer can't stop us!

Speaker: ruffian
Dialogue: The King is a Frenchman, but he is not one of us!

Speaker: ruffian
Dialogue: We'll give you their ears!

Speaker: rioter
Dialogue: They give us garbage, not fit for rats!  They think we are garbage!

Speaker: rioters
Dialogue: Three cheers for d'Artagnan! Hurrah...!!  Hurrah...!!

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: We already know about the riots!

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: We will tell him, when it is...

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: Convenient.

Speaker: young woman
Dialogue: Oh yes!  So good!  Ooo, wonderful, Marvelous!  Fan-tas --

Speaker: young woman
Dialogue: Oh, Louis, that was incredible.  It was better than ever before.  It --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'm hungry.

Speaker: young woman
Dialogue: I will have food brought.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I like to eat alone.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: By the way, you'll be moving tomorrow.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Aaa!  D'Artagnan!  These passages were constructed for the King's security, not so you could step from my father's portrait and startle me to death!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I already know about the riots, d'Artagnan, I heard them out there whispering.  Some fool gave the order to distribute rotten food.  I will deal with it tomorrow.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: A personal nature?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Betrothed?  I think not.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Miss Beaufort has accepted our invitation.  By this we can only suppose that she wishes to come -- as we wish her to be here.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: That is my desire, and my desire is what should concern you, not the sentiments of some commoner!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What quaint notions, d'Artagnan! But they contradict my father, who picked his queen when he was old, and only then to bear me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You dare criticize my father?!  Or lecture me?!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: That is enough!  You are a good servant, d'Artagnan, but you forget your place!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Silence!  I order you!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I will consider it.  Now leave me.

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: ... And I only say that... the rotten food was... all my fault... and I take... full responsibility... and beg the forgiveness of you all.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Well done, Pierre.  It will be good for your soul, that you have taken responsibility for your errors.  And don't worry, I will look after your family.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Do not rejoice -- but know that your King does not tolerate blunders that hurt his beloved people.  More food is on its way, and my advisors tell me the new harvests are sure to be bountiful!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And I have new joys to announce to you!  Today we decree a fresh glory for Paris, and for all of France! The laying of the foundations to expand Versailles, and make it truly a palace of the sun!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Aramis.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Your Majesty...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: How goes that favor I asked of you?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I grow closer to my target, your Majesty.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You bring me the heart of the Jesuit General, and you will have a palace of your own.

Speaker: handmaiden
Dialogue: After your bath put on this, it is the King's favorite color.  That letter on the desk came here for you this morning.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Raoul!

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: The army!  Oh Raoul, don't despair! I will always be faithful...

Speaker: handmaiden
Dialogue: If you need me further, just ring.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Sire!  I -- How did you --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: How did I get in?  You're new here, and will soon learn many secrets. What is that?

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: ... Nothing.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: A letter.  May I see?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: From Raoul.  He urges you to guard your honor -- as if it could be in any danger... from your king.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Raoul... is in love...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Enough of this, our dinner waits.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The food doesn't please you?

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: It's lovely.  It's just...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: This is more than you are used to. Your mother is a seamstress, your father is dead.  You have three younger sisters, two of whom suffer from consumption.  Don't look so surprised, Kings know such things.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: I... we are humble people...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Wait, no!  Do not be ashamed.  The straits of your family need not be permanent.  It is a simple matter to have them brought to one of my country estates, where they may have fine meals, and physicians to look after them.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: You would do that, your Majesty?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My dear, I've already done it.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Please, darling, that isn't necessary.  We are friends now. Mademoiselle needs wine!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You are beautiful.  You know you are.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Sire, I --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: If you don't want to be so appealing, why did you touch the rose to your skin?  Where was it? Here?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What is it?  Raoul?  If he really loved you, he would have proposed marriage.  He didn't, did he?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You have never known love until you have known the love of a king.

Speaker: jailer
Dialogue: It's a jolt at first, so brace yourself.

Speaker: new keeper
Dialogue: Ugh!  He looks 'orrible.

Speaker: new keeper
Dialogue: Stay back!

Speaker: new keeper
Dialogue: Scared?

Speaker: new keeper
Dialogue: Scared of you?  Not me.  I'll kill him if he gets near me.

Speaker: jailer
Dialogue: Moron.

Speaker: staff officer
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: raoul
Dialogue: Mi-cheeelllll!! --

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Sir... a casualty report came...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Get out of my way.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: To kill the king.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: The King killed my son!

Speaker: young musketeer
Dialogue: I'll kill the old man for you, Captain, if you don't wish to --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Come on!  All of you!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Coward!  Fight me!  Fight me...!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He killed my son, d'Artagnan!  He killed my son...!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Your Majesty... it is Andre.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Shall I leave?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No, you may wait behind the screen.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: I would not have disturbed you, Majesty, but you ordered me to keep you informed --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes, yes, go on.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Athos, the former Musketeer, has just fought with several of your guard, at the Musketeers' Gate.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Did they kill him?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: No.  He cut an ear from one of the men, no one else was hurt.  Captain d'Artagnan allowed him to leave. Athos was upset about the death of his son, at the front.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Who was Athos seeking?  Tell me! Did he try to enter the palace?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: ... He did -- but Captain d'Artagnan blocked his way.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You may go, Lieutenant.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Do you want Athos arrested, your Majesty?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Not by you.  I will order d'Artagnan to do it.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My dear!  The glass -- !

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Did you know... about Raoul?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I did not want to upset you.  It was tragic.  I did everything I could for him.  I ordered him positioned in a spot of complete safety, far from the fighting.  But he disregarded my wishes and charged into danger.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I will order a Mass for his soul. It will guarantee his place in Heaven.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Oh Louis, Louis...

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Aramis... is this the way to hell?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Hell may be our destination, dear Porthos, but not this trip.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Where are we?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Jesus of Nazareth found the holy among the profane.  If we are to have a place of private prayer, where better than here, beside the channels where the shit and the garbage run to the river?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Mother of God!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It is also a place of burial.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: A tomb?  We're in a tomb?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Catacombs.  Very holy.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Yaaaahhh!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Relax, you big fool, it's d'Artagnan.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It's all right.  D'Artagnan was the one who warned us that he'd been given an order for your arrest. Here you have sanctuary -- does he not, d'Artagnan?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Look at us.  We are old men now.  But once we were young.  And when we saw injustice, we fought it.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: And some problems cannot be settled without one.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Well here is the problem at hand: the King has ordered me to discover the identity of the Governor General of Jesuits, and kill him.  As our English rivals have left the Catholic Church, Louis has struck on a plan to dominate the whole of Europe by uniting Church and State and making himself head of both.  He has already picked the Pope.  Only the Jesuits, who put God above throne or papacy, stand in his way.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: But -- doesn't God ordain both Pope and King?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: So they tell us.  But what are we to believe when the king is a tyrant, and the Church, meant to stand for all those oppressed, has become the tool of oppression?  When no conscience is tolerated?  No dissent, no objection?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It is a weighty problem, Aramis -- but perhaps you should leave it to this secret General of the Jesuits, whoever he might be.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Easy to say, but hard to do.  For what I am trying to tell you is that I am the Governor General of Jesuits in France.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What do you propose to do?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Replace the king.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It can't be done.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It can.  I know the way.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I am with you!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I will need you all.  All for one. One for all.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: It is honor you serve, and when the king is dishonorable you are removed from your oath of honor!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Why do you follow him, d'Artagnan?! I know you have put service above your own life, but why does this King deserve such loyalty?  He is a monster!  He executes ministers for his own blunders, with their families hostage so they take the blame!  He has no honor!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Whatever the plan... I am in it! The next time we meet, one of us will die.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Porthos, see to Athos, won't you?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I have heard many confessions, d'Artagnan.  But even if I were not a priest, I could tell your heart has a secret weight, and it is hurting you to carry it alone.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I know.  God go with you.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What are they doing?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Making the key to the throne.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: They are very large keys.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Porthos sleeps, and you plot.  Don't you think it's time you told me what it is you are plotting?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Soon enough.  Here we are.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: The Prison of Belle Sur.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Come, we have a boat waiting.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: A body.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I see that is a body!  But where did you get it?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: He gets one day of confession each year.  Today is the day.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Who does?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Best not to ask.  Shouldn't even talk about it.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What do we do now?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I don't know about you, but I plan to wait here.

Speaker: head guard
Dialogue: Who is this, then?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: He says he's the replacement.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: He says it is only one day a month when the prisoner gets confession, and the little one is too sick to move.  The big one doesn't speak French either.

Speaker: head guard
Dialogue: Then let's get it done.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I am a friend, here to help you.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It is an escape.  To freedom.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: He is you.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Hey!  Hey!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What now?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: He says he just fell stone dead as he was reading him the Mass.

Speaker: head guard
Dialogue: I never thought the bugger would last this long.  But how could he just keel over and --

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: He says the prisoner has the fever, just like the little priest does.

Speaker: head guard
Dialogue: Plague?  They brought plague in here?  Get him out of here.  Now!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: No, no last rites!  Get away!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: My God...

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It's all right.  Take your time.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Athos... He needs a gentle hand.

Speaker: guard 1
Dialogue: You ever wonder who he was?

Speaker: guard 2
Dialogue: No... Yes.  But I never asked -- and you better not either.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Jesuits.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: What is wrong?  We only mean to free you from the mask!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Prison was horrible but it was his home.  He's been torn from it by strangers.  He's frightened, exhausted -- and the mask is familiar.  Let him rest in it tonight, and remove it tomorrow.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Excellent, Athos.  You have a keen sense of this man.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: His plight is obvious, isn't it?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: And why are you so glum?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I expected action.  There was no killing, no fighting, I was useless.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Are you hungry?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Who came?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: And you never knew why?

Speaker: prisoner
Dialogue: I thought... there is something about my face that men do not want to see.  Something that makes them cruel.  But then I realized they were cruel even when I was wearing the mask.  I knew there must be some other reason, but I could not think what it was.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What is your name?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Phillippe.  Rest now.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Take this to my mother.

Speaker: nun
Dialogue: M'lady... are you...?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Please, just... go away.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: See?  There is plenty of food in the country.  But the King keeps it going to the army instead of --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He is sleeping.  Now see here, Aramis, it's time you told us --

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I have no appetite for food, I am wasting away.  Say goodbye to Porthos, for he is gone.  Even women don't interest me now.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I tell you a secret.  I sleep with three women at once, not because my appetite is so great, but because now it take three to excite me.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Who is he, Aramis?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Tomorrow.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Tonight!  Right now!  We steal a man from a royal prison, we hide in a country chateau among an assortment of saints and sluts such as only you could provide, and still you wish to tell me nothing?!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You seek facts, when it would be better to seek truth.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You are not my priest, Aramis!  You would not be, even if I had one.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You are bitter, Athos.  You are torn by grief, not only for Raoul, but for d'Artagnan, whom you love, and now treat as an enemy.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He who is not with us is against us.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Those are the words of a broken spirit.  My spirit is whole.  I have trusted d'Artagnan with my deepest secrets, and I will never believe he is my enemy.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Then you are a fool -- a fool who has never lost a son.  What gives you the right to judge me, to play God with the lives of others?  Is it because you are so much holier than everyone else?!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: There is that, of course -- but mainly it is because I am so much smarter than everyone else.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Porthos?!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Kidney rocks.  It hurts when I pee. It hurts when I shit.  I'm just a fat old fart with nothing to live for any more.  I'm going to hang myself, as soon as I'm sober.

Speaker: nun
Dialogue: M'lady...?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Oh God I -- Forgive me...

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: No, stay back!  Stay back!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: D'Artagnan!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: If I don't kiss you, I die anyway.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Nothing... Nothing.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Nothing.  This... didn't happen.  I must go back now.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Then we will both die traitors, d'Artagnan.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What is wrong?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What is wrong?!

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Raoul... Oh, Raoul...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Listen, my darling... Raoul was a... a good friend.  And now he is dead and that is very sad but --

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: We'll burn in hell.  Both of us.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No, my love.  You will burn in hell, for your sins.  But I will not -- for I am King.  My position is ordained by God.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan!  Guards!

Speaker: louis' voice
Dialogue: Help!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Out there!  Look!  Out there!  He --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It... was nothing.  A nightmare, nothing more.  Go away, I --

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Aramis!  Athos!  He looks exactly like... exactly like...

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I will answer all your questions. But first soap, water, and a razor.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Yes.  Identical.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: The greatest secret of life is who we truly are.  Now I must give you that secret, which has been kept from you your whole life.  It began on the night when Louis was born.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I remember that night.  D'Artagnan was drunk, the only time I've seen him that way.  The three of us were reveling, remember, Athos?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: But I was on duty...

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: I was summoned to the royal apartments.  Arrange a carriage, they told me, and wait by the door of the stables.

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: They brought a baby from the back of the palace, into the black carriage I had waiting.  They had given the driver instructions about where it was, and I was ordered to make the whole journey with the blinds of the carriage drawn.

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: I carried that baby into the countryside, to a chateau, like this one.  And there I left him.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I have never forgotten that night, or what I carried.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I don't understand.  What does this have to do with...?  You carried a baby somewhere, it's unusual, but --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Not just a baby, Porthos.  I carried the child of the king.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: The child of the king is... the king.  Louis!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: No, not Louis!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Athos, do you understand this?  He confuses me --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I carried the king's child!  The queen had twins that night, and one of them was sent away, in secret!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: But why?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Because the old king had a twin as well, and through his whole reign his brother fought him for the throne.  Then he had two heirs, not just sons but twins.  So he decided that one be put away, as if he never existed.  You, Phillippe.

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: The old king ordered you be educated and well treated, but your identity kept from you and all those around you.

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: On his death bed, he revealed your existence to Louis and your mother. Your mother had been told by her own priest that you had died at birth. Somehow she blamed herself for ever believing it, and she wished to restore your birthright.  But now Louis was king.

Speaker: aramis' voice
Dialogue: A priest, even a Pope, he could kill without hesitation, but he was afraid to kill you, for his whole claim to power rests on the sanctity of royal blood.  So he had you hidden in a way that only a monster could devise.  I know, for it was I who took you to prison, and the Iron Mask.  Someday I will ask your forgiveness.  But not until we have restored to you what is yours.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Restored...?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: We will replace Louis with Phillippe.  No one but the King himself -- and now we -- knows Phillippe even exists.  All we have to do is switch them.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Switch?!  That is your plan?  It is ludicrous!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I have it all worked out.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Physical resemblance is but one small thing!  Louis has an arrogance, a manner --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Those can be adopted --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: And people close to him, who --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Do you think I have not considered that?  I have a plan -- and you may rest assured that it is brilliant!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: It is not just our lives you risk with this conceit of yours!  It is Phillippe's as well!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Yes, and he has a choice!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: What about it, Phillippe?!  All that time in prison, all that time you suffered, was it for nothing?!  You memorized the entire Bible, or so your priest told me!  An act of survival, of defiance, of courage! Your years within the mask have given you reserves of strength that others could not imagine.  Your home was a dungeon and now you may be a king, if you have the heart to make it so!  Do you have the heart?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: I will try.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You see?  A king.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Recent hours have been a shock.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Perhaps not as much as you might imagine.  When tutors answered every question except those about who I was.  When I was imprisoned in a way no other man had ever been, I knew there was something different about me.  But a king...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Phillippe... there is something I hope you understand.  Terrible cruelty has been used against you. And... you must understand that you did nothing to deserve it.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: There is... wrath... in me.  I have learned to hide it.  Those years in the cell, I dreamed that freedom would someday just happen, the way the mask happened.  Now I am free. And with each free breath I feel the growing desire to make someone suffer for all I lost.  Look at this, all this that for ten years I could not see!  What if I become a king -- a king no different from my brother?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: The desire for vengeance... can be a poison.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: What is its antidote?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I suppose... it is to remember there are many people who have never been in a prison, who pass such beauty every day, and never see it.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: You look so sad.  Is it something I have done?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: It is something I have done -- or did not do.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I did not share beauty with someone... who is no longer here for me to share beauty with.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: We have much to do, we'd best get started.  Now suppose you were to walk into a garden, as a king...

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: More wine!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: How is he?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Resting, he's had a long day. Aramis --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: More wine!!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You must reconsider this plan. Phillippe is like a child, he --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You can do it.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: In a year, maybe two, I could teach him enough to --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Three days.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Three days??!!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: The King is having a ball, a masquerade ball.  It is the perfect opportunity and perhaps our only one.  At any time Phillippe could be discovered, and what then?  Remember France.  Remember the poor. Remember Raoul.  More wine!!  Where are those serving girls...?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It's no use.  My sword is bent.

Speaker: serving woman
Dialogue: It'll be all right.  You're just taking a while to get started.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: No, it's dead.  I am useless.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Phillippe -- he's very bright, he's perceptive, but he is in such turmoil --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You grow fond of him.  That's good.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Don't play God with me, Aramis I --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But -- what is Porthos doing?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Going into the barn naked -- or so it appears.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Now.  You were saying?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But -- what is he doing?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: About to hang himself, I should think.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Hang himself?!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: He's threatened to do it, it's been building up in him for months.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: We must stop him!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Come now, Athos, if Porthos is determined to end his life, then he will certainly manage to find the opportunity.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But -- but --

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: A'dieu, cruel life!  Farewell to useless Porthos!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I sawed the main beam in half.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I'm a genius -- not an engineer!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Aramis!!  You did this, didn't you! You knew I would try hanging myself, and you sawed the beam!  Admit it! Admit it, by God!!  ADMIT IT!!!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Well of course I knew it, Porthos.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You've been moping for months.  Now that you've gotten the idea of killing yourself out of the way, you can stop boring me and start being useful to me.  Now get some rest.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Well... Well... Okay.

Speaker: wench
Dialogue: AAAAAAHHHHHHH!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Poor Phillippe!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: The mask is terrifying... especially when unexpected.  Do you notice?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: All I noticed was that Phillippe feels even more like an animal.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: See, Porthos -- secrets are hard to keep.  We don't have much time.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: I've worn this mask so long, I couldn't sleep without it.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I will sit with you.  I can't sleep either.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Athos...?  Thank you for being my guide... back into the world.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Where are you going?!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Paris.  There is still much to do. We'll be back soon.  Be ready.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But Aramis -- !  Phillippe can learn in time, but --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: He can learn to be Phillippe in time.  But first he must learn to be Louis, and for that he has two more days.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: What you're asking is impossible!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I offer you the perfect revolution. A revolution without bloodshed, without any loss of life, even without treason, for he too is the son of the King.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: You said you'd do anything, Athos, anything to replace this King.  So do it.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: No, wait, do not hold your goblet that way.  With a king it is... so.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: It is not to be dainty.  Servants have touched the King's goblet, so he will touch it as little as possible.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: I am so sorry!  Forgive me, I --

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: No!  Do not be sorry!  Never be sorry!  The King cares for nothing and for no one!  There are no mistakes when you are King!  What you do is right for every person!  A King has contempt for everyone!

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Is that the king of king you wish me to be?  Or do you say this because of your son?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: How did you know -- ?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Porthos told me.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: I am not... I am not angry with you. You understand?  Good.  Now, as to acting like a king, we wish you to be a good king.  But at first... at first you must pass as Louis, and Louis is cold and cruel.  So you must stop looking at people with such softness.  It is... not Kingly. The eyes of a King say that all he cares about is himself, and your eyes -- how do I tell him this -- ? You eyes... ask so much.  You shouldn't care about me, about my -- about...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Oh Raoul, my son... my son...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Come, we have much to do.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Coming?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: What use am I?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: We go someplace dangerous.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Why didn't you say so?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It is good to be out on a mission again... We are out on a mission, aren't we?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: You're right.  Tell Porthos nothing. He needs to know nothing, for he is useless.

Speaker: robber
Dialogue: Your money or your life.

Speaker: third robber
Dialogue: Make it quick, old man!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Old?  Old?!  You're all trying to rob us because you think we're old?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Old?!  I'll show you old!!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Let's see you rob somebody with your pistol there!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Come on...

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: I have to tell you something.  I love Paris!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Here we are.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Aramis... These are... these are whores!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: So was Mary Magdalene, and our Lord loved her.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Did she have tits like that?

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: What do you want?  White?  Black? Both?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: No.  We want you, Father Belles.

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: Get out!  Now!  I will kill you where you stand!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned.

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: Don't!  Get out!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I have sinned.  And no other priest's assurance of forgiveness can mean as much as yours.  Tell me that I can be forgiven, no matter what I have done.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: He's going to kill you, Aramis.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Then let him kill me, if all my faith is wrong.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: I have come to help you make it right.  I have come to take you home.

Speaker: priests
Dialogue: Father Belles!

Speaker: monk
Dialogue: You have made a miracle!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: God makes miracles.  You make dinner.

Speaker: jesuit
Dialogue: The ball has been rescheduled -- for tomorrow.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: These rooms are yours.  Up these stairs -- or through this hidden passage -- is the room of your mistress... Michelle.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Whose rooms are those?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Your mother's.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Change the horses!  Clear out everything!  NOW!!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Aramis, this will never --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Louis is planning a visit to the Vatican, then who knows where after that.  If we miss him now we may not get another chance.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: But --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It presses us but it is good for us too!  Louis' whims make him more vulnerable.  We are less ready, but so are his guards!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan, unready?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: At a ball, everyone watches the King!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: But what if something extraordinary happened?  Something so unusual that all the attention went to someone else?  Someone whose confirmation of Phillippe the King would never be questioned.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: The Queen Mother.  Anne.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Bless me Father, for I have sinned.

Speaker: father belles
Dialogue: So have I.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Father Belles -- ?!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: They told me you were dead.

Speaker: father belles
Dialogue: I was.  I see you are still a woman of faith.  I have come back to ask you if you believe that one lie can poison your whole life... and one truth can put it back together again.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It shall be interesting tonight.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You will protect me as you always have, d'Artagnan.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: By the way, Claude -- inform Mademoiselle Beaufort that she will be moving from her rooms --

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Never mind, it seems we have already told her.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: Murderer!  Murderer!

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: I wrote Fromberge!  Under your seal! I wrote as you, demanding to know why he disregarded my order to keep Raoul from danger!  He writes back: "But your Majesty!  Your last letter ordered me to put him in front of the cannon!"

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Hysterical woman.

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: Sire, misuse of the royal seal -- !

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: She'll be gone tomorrow.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Mother -- ?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: May I speak with you?  Alone?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I am preparing for a ball!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: We haven't visited in three years. And we should have privacy.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What is it, mother?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: I wish to discuss your brother.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He is dead!  By God's choice!  There is nothing to discuss.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: First they told me he had died at birth.  Then your father admitted he was alive, but well cared for, in secret.  But the message that told of his death said he had been a prisoner.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I am King, Mother!  And I do not wish to discuss this with you.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: He was my blood -- and I demand to know what happened to him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Why would you ask now?  You never asked before!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Because I have dreamed of him.  Not as the baby they took away, but as a man.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You have prayed too much.  Your mind is weak.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: I believe in dreams, Louis.  They are our souls speaking to us, from that world beyond our eyes.  And that son I never saw in daylight was standing in the moonlight of my dreams.  And he wore an iron mask.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It -- it doesn't matter, Mother!  He is dead now!  Dead!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Yes.  Dead.  Two nights ago.  The night of my dream.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: If... if he was wearing an iron mask in your dream, then how could you know he was your son?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Then you did do it, Louis.  You did put your brother in an iron mask.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I have a ball to attend!

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Whose carriage is this?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It was mine.  But since you are about to be the king, it is yours.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Phillippe first.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Remember, Phillippe... nobility is born in the heart.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Hold your goblet with two fingers.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: And make love as if you don't care. The way Kings do.  And fart whenever you wish.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Remember, all you have to do is get through tonight.  Smile and nod a lot, and if you get stuck just wave and announce, "Continue."  In the morning you hand this note to d'Artagnan, pardoning Athos and instructing that he, Aramis and Porthos be brought to the palace as your advisors.  And all is well.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Now the rest of us.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan watches everything.  We have to be lucky.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: We will make our own luck tonight... if Phillippe holds up.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Stay calm, you're doing fine.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: My brother...

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: He knew.  He knew what they did to me.

Speaker: young beauty
Dialogue: What is wrong, your majesty?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Nothing, I -- continue.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: There!  Do you see it?

Speaker: young beauty
Dialogue: See what, Majesty?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: ... tired.  Must... lie down.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Quick, to the passages.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: The room of the King's favorite mistress?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: She will be at the ball.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: It is Judgment Day.

Speaker: musketeers
Dialogue: Your Majesty.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Wh-- Wha--

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Don't look so shocked, Phillippe. Come, you're going back to prison.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Phillippe?!  Why do you call me --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan guards the hallway!  You must go back the way we came!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Now, your Majesty.  It is time.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You know the way.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You have your note?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You have the heart of a king.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Continue.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: My gracious noble lord...

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: How are you... Michelle?

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: How should I be?  I came to give this back to you.

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: Fret not with this, your Majesty --

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Stop!  You're hurting her!

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: However I have wronged you I will make amends.  Whatever the cost.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Continue.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Don't worry, your Majesty.  We have a prison for you, where you can rest peacefully.

Speaker: michelle
Dialogue: In... the ballroom.  But he isn't the same man.

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: To King Louis!  And to Anne, the Queen Mother!

Speaker: guests
Dialogue: To King Louis, and the Queen Mother!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: I retire now.  Wait two waltzes, then retire to your room; and spend the night in safety.  We have much to talk about, and have the rest of our lives to do it.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Good night, Mother.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Good night... my son.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: D'Artagnan.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: We have much to discuss.  Tomorrow.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Some while, Captain.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: He must've, Captain, there is no other way here.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Continue.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: ... The ball... Continue.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Yes...?  Why do you bring me here, d'Artagnan?

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: The King!  Look!  It's the King!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Wh-- ?  Where did he come from?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: If you ever loved me -- if you ever loved honor, or anything else -- then stand now, and let it happen.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: This man is an impostor.  We caught him trying to impersonate the King, and were just getting rid of him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan, arrest them all!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Shut up, knave!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Pull them back, d'Artagnan.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Pull them back!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Phillippe, get into the boat.  Into the boat!  Now!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Open the gate.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You will not shed royal blood!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I want all these passages sealed! Another stupid idea of my father's! Seal them all, every one!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Even the bedchamber passages!  Let none remain!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I was told this impostor was dead!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He is my brother.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My twin.  Which has kept him alive. Until now.

Speaker: anne's voice
Dialogue: No!!

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Louis, please -- !

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My guards are useless!  Take her from me!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What had you to do with this, Mother?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: He is your brother!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He is nothing now.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Get out of my way.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Forgive?!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: They have plotted against me!  Me! The embodiment of God's will!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You take the side of traitors?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Please, may I speak?  M'lord... I beg that you kill me.  I release you, before Almighty God, from any claim of sin in taking my life.  In fact I will pray that God reward you for your mercy to do it.  But do not -- I beg you -- return me to the prison, where I have lived so long.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan, you will hunt down Aramis, Porthos and Athos, and bring me their heads, or I will have yours.  And as for you, Phillippe... Back to the prison you shall go, and into the mask you hate.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: No, Louis!  No!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Wear it until you love it.  And die in it!!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What was that sound?!  Did you hear it?  It came from Michelle's room!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Where is Michelle?

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: I couldn't tell you.  You had enough to carry.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: D'Artagnan -- ?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: No.  Please!  No!

Speaker: blacksmith
Dialogue: Pay me quick, I want out of here.

Speaker: guards
Dialogue: What --

Speaker: bastille jailer
Dialogue: You saw the prisoner's face.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Now.  Where is d'Artagnan?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Out directing the search for the traitors.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: When he returns, watch him.  When he leaves again, you tell me.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Bloody hell...

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: We can't... stay here.  That traitor d'Artagnan... knows about this place.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Can we eat... before we go?  This excitement's given me an appetite.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Bread and wine... in that cupboard.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: A note.  Pinned with a dagger, like the old days.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: "Phillippe has been removed to the Bastille, to the lower dungeon.  At midnight tonight I will order the guard changed, and will delay the replacements for ten minutes.  That should give you ample time.  Never have I needed more to say:  One for all, and all for one.  D'Artagnan."

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He lures us to capture.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: He seeks redemption.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You're a fool!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Perhaps.  But of d'Artagnan I am certain.  What he did tonight was what he told us all along he would do -- be faithful to his King.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: So what has changed?

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Perhaps he serves a different king.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: What choice is there?  If Phillippe is in the Bastille, then to the Bastille we will go.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: You are right.  But it is a trap.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: So what?  I'd rather die covered in blood, than an old man, lying in my own piss.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Then to the Bastille.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: To the Bastille.  And death.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: Open up!  We have a prisoner!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Take him down to level three.  The Captain will see to the documents.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: It worked!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: It's a prison, you idiot!  They don't expect anyone to try getting in!  The problem will come when we want out!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Midnight!  We have ten minutes!

Speaker: jailer
Dialogue: Hey...!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Phillippe...?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: How did you --

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Someone's coming!

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He lies.  He is here to trap us.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan is right, the courtyard is filling with soldiers!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: They will know you helped us, if we go this way.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: There!  Stop them!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Betrayed!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Back the way we came!

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Back!

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: Trapped.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Charge them!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Cowards!  Twenty run from four?!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: The corridor nullifies our number... And no one has stomach to fight the Captain.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan!

Speaker: louis' voice
Dialogue: I am not angry with you.  I knew you would lead me to them, and so you have!  Lay down your sword, and I will not punish you!  I will let you retire in peace -- to live out your days in the countryside!  And I will give your friends a swift execution, if you surrender now.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan.  Perhaps you should accept his offer, for we are dead anyway.

Speaker: porthos
Dialogue: He is right, d'Artagnan.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: Wait.  Bargain me to Louis, for all your lives.  You have done your best.  Let me go, and let all of you find peace.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: D'Artagnan... Those are young Musketeers down there.  They have been weaned on our legends.  They revere us -- it is an advantage. Why don't we charge them?

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: One for all.  All for one.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: If I could have a blade, then I would be please to run with you.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Magnificent valor...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Shoot them!  Shoot them!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Draw blades!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: I am unhurt --

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: You!  Vicious... evil...!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Brother...?

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: All this time... I was a lost secret.  But you were hiding all your loyalty, all your love.  You were the Man in the Iron Mask.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: D'Artagnan...

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: All my life, all I ever wanted to be... was him.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: We have recaptured the prisoner.

Speaker: king
Dialogue: You will put this madman where no one can hear his insanity.  Let him be fed by a deaf mute.  But feed him well, and let him have a long life within the Iron Mask.

Speaker: bastille governor
Dialogue: And them?

Speaker: king
Dialogue: They are my loyal servants.

Speaker: aramis
Dialogue: Amen.

Speaker: athos
Dialogue: He was the best of us all.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: I will be with you in a moment, Mother.

Speaker: phillippe
Dialogue: After all you have done, I must ask you one more service to your king. I have lost my father.  And you have lost your son.  Let me love you like a son to a father.  And I pray you live for this, to love me like your son.
